actions.text: Reported to Senate from the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, S. Rept. 94-522.
Referred to Senate committee on the Budget.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Budget, S. Rept. 94-543.

official_title: An original resolution to waive the requirements of section 303(a) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 with respect to the consideration of S. 2635.

summary.text: Waives with respect to the consideration of S. 2635, provisions of the Congressional Budget Act which provides that it shall not be in order for the House or Senate to consider any bill or resolution which provides new budget authority or new spending authority until the first Concurrent Resolution on the budget for such year has been agreed to. States that as a result of this year's social security increases, 1,327, 136 veterans and survivors will sustain pension reductions and another 41,840 will lose entitlement to pension altogether unless amendments increasing rates pursuant to S. 2635 become law effective January 1, 1976. States that the waiver is also necessary to allow the Congress to complete work regarding veterans and survivors pension reform which the Committee on Veterans' Affairs has carried on throughout the preceding two years in good faith and without any intent to circumvent the congressional budget process.

titles.title: An original resolution to waive the requirements of section 303(a) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 with respect to the consideration of S. 2635.
